pros: Flexible Arbeitszeiten und eine nette Arbeitsathmospäre
cons: Im Vergleich zur privaten Wirtschaft ist die Kompensation etwas niedrig.

pros: Good to work at the place where you study
cons: Salary is a bit too low for the amount of work No benefits No one considers it as a real work experience

job_title: Entry Level Assistant HR Clerk in Berlin
pros: Sicherer Arbeitsplatz und TVL Sonderzahlung, sowie Tarifbindung
cons: Anbindung, starre und veraltete Strukturen

review_title: Review about PhD position at FU Berlin
pros: High research level, support from colleagues
cons: Time consuming bureaucracy in things related to administration.

pros: Nice colleagues, nice library, network opportunities
cons: WiMis in Praedoc positions are exploited, they are paid part-time to work more than full time on tasks that are not research/teaching related. The bureaucracy is extremely layered, inefficient, and not up to speed with the current agile framework. WiMis often need to take over administrative tasks due to the lack of qualified staff in the administration (even though there are three times as many). No one seems to care about the precarious condition of researchers and professors justify this medieval work environment by saying that academia has always been like this. Working a second job is permitted but very vigorously opposed.

pros: nothing I can think of right now
cons: Too bureaucratic. Very hierarchical. Some departments are run like fiefdoms.

review_title: Good research Environment and good Professor
pros: Professors are super kind and nice
cons: benefits are not that much for employees.

pros: you can get a phd degree, if finished
cons: The professors are different, check with the former group members before accepting any positions.

pros: Great researchers, focused environment, nice colleagues. In a green and clean quarter of Berlin
cons: It's a bit far from the center.

pros: Students, libraries, parts of the campus, Berlin.
cons: Bureaucracy (slow). No contribution to private health. Stingy.

pros: flexible working time and good experience how to survive
cons: you must leave the position after some time and difficult to get extension

International environment

review_title: why I am looking for new job.
pros: due to love in the academic area and the research group is effortful.
cons: the salary is not good for the researcher to work the whole week and sometimes on the weekends.

review_title: Good wroking climate and labor rules
pros:
Flexible working hours
Good laboratory equipment
Good labor rules
cons: Career opportunities are low. Though it's a very old university, the students or employees looking for jobs are not well recognised.

review_title: OK for few years of the PhD project
pros: Free atmosphere for the research
cons: High level of bureaucracy if quite high

pros: Freedom to expand your horizons, learn new technologies.
cons: No actual developer teamwork, no business demands and proper feedback

pros: Diverse environment, nice people. Good to improve oneself.
cons: The university is too far located.

review_title: Great doctoral research time in FU Berlin
pros: Very nice research topic, and great collaboration with top lab.
cons: It is better to isolate the lab with the lecture halls.

pros: Flexible, Challenging, Varied work, Many holidays and good network
cons: Low salary, high administration, not many growth possibilities and very slow processes

pros: flexible working hours and comfortable office
cons: too far away from the city center

pros: Great colleagues and much freedom
cons: Tedious administration and poor communication

pros: It's reputation to be an international University at the forefront of science.
cons: Unsopportive and with professors that are more careful about their careers than promoting science. The administration is simply a mess. Everything to be evolved by 100 years.

pros: supportive supervisor and research environment
cons: poor adminisrtation especially the HR department

pros: flexible time, English speaking team
cons: limited contract, low payments, inefficient administration

pros: Safe contract, nice pay, nice human environment (research).
cons: Bureaucracy can be heavy and unreasonable, old buildings.

review_title: A large administration not apt for fast projects
pros: A lot of independence in planning and performing research projects
cons: Complex, intransparent administration that is hindering quick project preparation and implementation.

pros: The students are the highlight here!
cons: No prospects for majority of qualified scholars if they are not professors

pros: study phd scholarship learning education
cons: goodness fairness justice love gaining

pros: Flexible working hours, reasonable pay with full time job, union tariffs, family friendly, University benefits like sports activities
cons: Mostly temporary employment, bureaucracy, very late reimbursement of travel expenses (we're talking a year)

pros: Nice campus, transparent working conditions, really liked researching in my group, cheap food in the big mensa (if you're enrolled as a student)
cons: As with many public institutions, the affiliation was very bureaucratic, updating information, pay checks, prolonging contracts etc.

pros: Flexibility, open-mindedness, research, staff, located in Berlin
cons: Too many regulations, location, salary

pros: I earn a decent salary and have little oversight from boss
cons: you have to work in dahlem. university bureaucracy is German AF

pros: clear way of work, friendly co workers, nice work space
cons: too many paper works, the working space it too small

pros: Independent work, several research seminars
cons: Limited data access, few people around, location

review_title: Freie Universität Berlin from a TA perspective
pros: One of the best universities in the social sciences in Germany. Recently added to the ranks of "Elite Universities". Located in the best German city for young people: Berlin.
cons: Similar to other German universities. Your career chances are much lower in academia than if going to a top tier university in the US. Management/Prof. usually not really well-equipped to manage their staff of PhD students.

pros: Location in Berlin.  Dynamic and interesting international academic environment in the city as a whole.
cons: Budget problems lead to very severe financial pressure.  Little rational long-term planning is possible, since all initiatives are financed by short-term external money.  Salaries for professors are contingent on meeting specific and often unreasonable targets for grant spending.  Failure to reach these targets result in permanent salary cuts.  Highly inflexible bureaucratic organization.

pros: In general, FU provides a stimulating research environment; it hosts several research collaborative centers; a lot of opportunities for soft skill training are offered through Dahlem research school
cons: Regular scientific duties are usually encompassed with teaching duties also for PhD students payed by third-party funding; in general teaching activities are not well regulated;

review_title: Working at FU as a RA
pros: The pay is decent and work environment & infrastructure is overall positive. At the same time, the demands on time for me were not too high, while opportunities for self-improvement were given.
cons: In-fighting is a problem, and that also very ideologically charged. Overall this place is run by highly career-driven people and not necessarily in a good way.

review_title: FU Berlin as an international student
pros: Green campus just outside of the city, good opportunities for graduate students, many potential research projects with the plethora of other institutes in the city. Multiple financing resources but best to know the right people.
cons: Very few professorships. No other long term positions.

pros: It has great lab facilities, the staff (permanent or on part-time working hours) is supportive and very knowledgeable, the University offers a variety of funding opportunities for abroad students/researchers.
cons: While the university is known for its international staff, however it is very difficult to obtain a permanent position as a foreigner

review_title: Solid German university, fraught by in-fighting
pros: Good conditions for graduate school students and a broad array of different subject areas, allowing for great interdisciplinary project work and relates initiatives.
cons: Dwindling number of professorships and thus fewer and fewer possibilities to gain real work experience in the higher education sector for future career moves.

review_title: Great place for students looking to support themself financially
pros: Flexible working hour, and good salary. Also no time required to commute if you are already at the campus.
cons: Nothing in particular. Needs to be organised in order to make sure you can handle both academic work and the job.

pros: Highly collaborative and international environment, with all the positives of the German work ethic
cons: As a scientist, the focus the university places on the humanities could sometimes be frustrating

pros:
- Relaxed working  culture
- Good industry ties
cons:
- Not social
- Not very active (invited speakers, poster days, etc)

review_title: student job at external relations department
pros: good salary, working hours flexible
cons: location is a little far from city center

pros:
Work / Life balance
A lot of opportunities
cons:
Passive atmosphere
Lack in communication
Partially archaic organization

pros: Good atmosphere to study and work
cons: Coul dhave more international programs

cons: Im Vergleich zur privaten Wirtschaft ist die Kompensation etwas niedrig.
